title: This is really sad. Can a Rioter explain what is being done about these players?
body:
This player is Diamond.
This player has over 300 ranked games *this season.*

In this particular game, it 'played' to make it look like it was trying, but it trolled all game.
It was raging at our Fizz over it's last game in the lobby.
When the game started, I asked it to help me at gromp and it just said 'no'
At level 1, it ran into Darius and tried to auto him to death, giving him first blood.
It returned to lane, and kept spamming pings on me while I jungled, spamming 'omfg jg useless.' I was level 3 Diana, at wolves.
It continued to spam pings on me, and then threatened to AFK if I didn't gank.
I hit level 6 and ganked; once I engaged, it just stood there spamming mastery and laugh, not helping.
This shit continued for the rest of the game.

http://i.imgur.com/IMCPsVA.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/GfTzgMt.jpg

In it's match history, there are at least 7 games in the past 3 days that are obviously the same thing.

Sorry, but this is retarded. I could ask why this player isn't banned, but I know why they aren't banned: because they're making it look like they're trying, even though they're obviously trolling.

What is being done about this? This isn't a unique case. This shit happens constantly at Diamond. It's been three years since this behavior has become a daily occurrence, and it's only getting worse as everyone realizes that they can get away with it.

Quite the opposite, the LCS is a prime example of how we know there *isn't* a replay system. 

The LCS uses the spectator system, which allows them to rewind in that particular match, but once the spectator client is closed, it's gone. Notice that they have to use the exact same footage for replays, from one of two view points, and they never go back to get better clips.
